PandasIndex

class babydragon.memory.indexes.pandas_index.PandasIndex[source]

Bases: MemoryIndex

A class to create an index of a pandas DataFrame, allowing querying on specified columns. Inherits from MemoryIndex class.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) –

  • row_func (Callable[[Series], str] | None) –

  • columns (List[str] | None) –

__init__(df, row_func=None, name='pandas_index', columns=None, load=False)[source]

Initialize a PandasIndex object.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – A pandas DataFrame to index.

  • row_func (Callable[[Series], str] | None) – An optional function to process rows before adding them to the index.

  • columns (List[str] | None) – An optional list of column names to index. By default, it will index all string columns and columns containing lists with a single string.

setup_columns(columns=None)[source]

Set up columns for indexing.

Parameters:

columns (List[str] | None) – An optional list of column names to index. By default, it will index all string columns and columns containing lists with a single string.

query_columns(query, columns)[source]

Query the indexed columns of the DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • query (str) – The search query as a string.

  • columns (List[str]) – A list of column names to query.

Returns:

A list of tuples containing the matched value and its similarity score.

Return type:

List[Tuple[str, float]]

add_row(row)[source]

Add a row to the DataFrame and update the row and column indexes.

Parameters:

row (Series) – A pandas Series representing the row to add.

Return type:

None

remove_row(index)[source]

Remove a row from the DataFrame and update the row and column indexes.

Parameters:

index (int) – The index of the row to remove.

Return type:

None

rows_from_value(value, column=None)[source]

Return all rows of the DataFrame that have a particular value in the row index or a column index.

Parameters:

  • value (str | int | float) – The value to search for in the DataFrame.

  • column (str | None) – The name of the column to search in. If None, search in the row index.

Returns:

A pandas DataFrame containing the rows with the specified value.

Return type:

DataFrame

apply_llmtask(path, chatbot, task_name=None, write_func=None, columns=None, task_id=None, max_workers=1, calls_per_minute=20)[source]

Apply a writing task to the specified columns or the main index, and create new modified indexes and a corresponding DataFrame with new values.

Parameters:

  • write_task – An instance of a writing task (subclass of BaseTask).

  • columns (List[str] | None) – A list of column names to apply the writing task to, or None (default) to apply the task to the main index.

  • path (List[List[int]]) –

  • chatbot (Chat) –

  • calls_per_minute (int) –

Returns:

A pandas DataFrame containing the modified values in the specified columns or a new column with the modified values of the main index.

Return type:

DataFrame
